channel.title: Introduction on Amazon CloudOps Linux Workshop
channel.description: Recent content in Introduction on Amazon CloudOps Linux Workshop

item.title: Prerequisites
item.description: You’ll need to setup your laptop with various tools in order to complete the labs in this module. AWS Account Administrative access to your laptop (macOS or Windows) Amazon Chime client for Windows or macOS PuTTY installed and working (if you use Windows) Your own Github account and a git client Slack

item.title: Why Linux? Who uses it?
item.description: Linux in the datacenter Linux on IoT devices Linux on planes Linux on phones From Wikipedia: Linux is a family of open-source Unix-like operating systems based on the Linux kernel, an operating system kernel first released on September 17, 1991, by Linus Torvalds. Linux is typically packaged in a Linux distribution. Distributions include the Linux kernel and supporting system software and libraries, many of which are provided by the GNU Project.
